context: During an ongoing hands-on-keyboard attack via the Impacket toolkit, suspicious activity with the `powershell.exe` and `lsass.exe` processes was observed. This indicates a potential attempt by attackers to move laterally across the network to execute commands on other hosts. Attackers often use tools like Impacket in hands-on-keyboard attacks to install ransomware or other malicious payloads onto target devices.
question: Can you identify the process id, created time and command line of the attempted hidden execution of the dual-purpose tool?
solution_steps: There was ongoing hands-on-keyboard attack via Impacket toolkit initiated by an account with SID `S-2-5-21-571436798-3864380397-1837441745-3206` on 2024-07-04 22:35:01.395957+00:00.

An attempt to hide use of a dual-purpose tool was detected on process with Process ID `5752`, created on 2024-07-06t00:00:01.7155092z, and command line `iy2orr1e.rrg.exe -windowstyle hidden -encodedcommand qwa6afwauwbjahiaaqbwahqacwbcaeuaeabwag8acgb0aeearabgafmavabvagsazqbuafmaaqbnag4aaqbuaemazqbyahqalgbwahmamqa=`.
